info.description: OpenAI-compatible API for Jan Server powered by vLLM. High-performance, scalable inference service with automatic batching and optimized memory management.
info.title: ðŸ‘‹Jan Server API

parameters.name: request

200.description: Bulk operation result with counts and status

400.description: Invalid request - exceeds limits or validation error

404.description: One or more catalog IDs not found (when catalog_ids provided)

500.description: Internal server error during bulk operation

post.description: Handles the callback from the Google OAuth2 provider to exchange the authorization code for a token, verify the user, and issue access and refresh tokens.

parameters.description: Request body containing the authorization code and state
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad request (e.g., invalid state, missing code, or invalid claims)

401.description: Unauthorized (e.g., a user claim is not found or is invalid in the context)

get.description: Redirects the user to the Google OAuth2 authorization page to initiate the login process.

post.description: JWT-based guest login. If a valid refresh token cookie is present, it reuses the existing user session. Otherwise, it creates a new anonymous guest user and issues fresh tokens.

200.description: Successfully generated access token and set refresh token cookie

401.description: Unauthorized (e.g., expired or missing refresh token)

500.description: Internal Server Error (e.g., failed to generate ID, register guest, or create JWTs)

get.description: Remove refresh tokens from cookies to perform logout.

401.description: Unauthorized (e.g., expired or missing refresh token)

get.description: Retrieves the profile of the authenticated user based on the provided JWT.
Use a valid refresh token to obtain a new access token. The refresh token is typically sent in a cookie.

401.description: Unauthorized (e.g., expired or missing refresh token)

post.description:
Generates a model response for the given chat conversation. This is a standard chat completion API that supports both streaming and non-streaming modes without conversation persistence.

**Streaming Mode (stream=true):**
- Returns Server-Sent Events (SSE) with real-time streaming
- Streams completion chunks directly from the inference model
- Final event contains "[DONE]" marker

**Non-Streaming Mode (stream=false or omitted):**
- Returns single JSON response with complete completion
- Standard OpenAI ChatCompletionResponse format

**Storage Options:**
- `store=true`: Persist the latest input message and assistant response to the active conversation
- `store_reasoning=true`: Additionally persist reasoning content provided by the model
- When `store` is omitted or false, the conversation remains read-only

**Features:**
- Supports all OpenAI ChatCompletionRequest parameters
- Optional conversation context for conversation persistence
- User authentication required
- Direct inference model integration

parameters.description: Chat completion request with streaming options and optional conversation
parameters.name: request

200.description: Successful streaming response (when stream=true) - SSE format with data: {json} events

400.description: Invalid request payload, empty messages, or inference failure

get.description: List conversations for the authenticated user with optional referrer filtering.

parameters.description: Referrer filter
parameters.name: referrer

parameters.description: Maximum number of conversations to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Return conversations created after the given numeric ID
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Sort order (asc or desc)
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Set to 'all' to list conversations across the workspace (requires elevated permissions)
parameters.name: scope

post.description:
Create a new conversation to store and retrieve conversation state across Response API calls

**Features:**
- Create conversation with optional metadata (max 16 key-value pairs)
- Add up to 20 initial items to the conversation
- Returns conversation ID with `conv_` prefix
- Supports OpenAI Conversations API format

**Metadata Constraints:**
- Maximum 16 key-value pairs
- Keys: max 64 characters
- Values: max 512 characters

parameters.description: Create conversation request with optional items and metadata
parameters.name: request

400.description: Invalid request - validation failed or too many items

500.description: Internal server error - conversation creation failed

get.description:
Retrieve a conversation by ID with ownership verification

**Features:**
- Retrieves conversation metadata including creation timestamp
- Automatic ownership verification (user can only access their own conversations)
- Returns OpenAI-compatible conversation object

**Response Fields:**
- `id`: Conversation ID with `conv_` prefix
- `object`: Always "conversation"
- `created_at`: Unix timestamp
- `metadata`: User-defined key-value pairs

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

404.description: Conversation not found or access denied

post.description:
Update a conversation's metadata while preserving existing items

**Features:**
- Update metadata key-value pairs
- Replaces entire metadata object (not merged)
- Items remain unchanged
- Automatic ownership verification

**Metadata Constraints:**
- Maximum 16 key-value pairs
- Keys: max 64 characters
- Values: max 512 characters

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description: Update conversation request with new metadata
parameters.name: request

400.description: Invalid request - validation failed or invalid metadata

404.description: Conversation not found or access denied

delete.description:
Delete a conversation (soft delete). Items in the conversation will not be deleted but will be inaccessible.

**Features:**
- Soft delete (conversation marked as deleted, not physically removed)
- Items remain in database but become inaccessible
- Automatic ownership verification
- Returns deletion confirmation with conversation ID

**Response:**
- `id`: Deleted conversation ID
- `object`: Always "conversation.deleted"
- `deleted`: Always true

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

404.description: Conversation not found or access denied

get.description:
List all items in a conversation with cursor-based pagination support

**Features:**
- Cursor-based pagination using item IDs
- Configurable page size (1-100 items, default 20)
- Sort order control (ascending or descending)
- Optional include parameter for additional fields
- Returns paginated list with navigation cursors

**Pagination:**
- Use `after` cursor from previous response for next page
- `has_more` indicates if more items are available
- `first_id` and `last_id` provide cursor references

**Query Parameters:**
- `limit`: Number of items (1-100, default 20)
- `order`: Sort order ("asc" or "desc", default "desc")
- `after`: Item ID cursor for pagination
- `include`: Additional fields to include (optional)

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description: Item ID cursor to list items after (pagination)
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Number of items to return (1-100)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Sort order: asc or desc
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Additional fields to include in response
parameters.name: include

400.description: Invalid request - invalid parameters or conversation ID

404.description: Conversation not found or access denied

post.description:
Add items to a conversation. You may add up to 20 items at a time.

**Features:**
- Bulk item creation (max 20 items per request)
- Automatic item ID generation with `msg_` prefix
- Items added to conversation's active branch (default: MAIN)
- Returns list of created items with generated IDs

**Item Types:**
- `message`: User or assistant messages
- `tool_call`: Tool/function call items
- `tool_response`: Tool/function response items
- Other OpenAI-compatible item types

**Constraints:**
- Maximum 20 items per request
- Each item must have valid type and content
- Items are immutable after creation

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description: Additional fields to include in response
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: Create items request with array of items
parameters.name: request

400.description: Invalid request - too many items, invalid format, or validation failed

404.description: Conversation not found or access denied

500.description: Internal server error - item creation failed

get.description:
Retrieve a single item from a conversation by item ID

**Features:**
- Retrieve specific item by ID
- Returns complete item with all content
- Automatic ownership verification via conversation
- Optional include parameter for additional fields

**Response Fields:**
- `id`: Item ID with `msg_` prefix
- `type`: Item type (message, tool_call, etc.)
- `role`: Role for message items (user, assistant)
- `content`: Item content array
- `status`: Item status (completed, incomplete, etc.)
- `created_at`: Unix timestamp

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description: Item ID (format: msg_xxxxx)
parameters.name: item_id

parameters.description: Additional fields to include in response
parameters.name: include

400.description: Invalid conversation ID or item ID format

404.description: Conversation or item not found, or access denied

delete.description:
Delete an item from a conversation. The item will be removed from the conversation.

**Features:**
- Remove specific item from conversation
- Automatic ownership verification
- Returns updated conversation object after deletion
- Items are permanently removed (not soft delete)

**Important:**
- Deleting an item may affect conversation flow
- Item IDs are not reused after deletion
- Other items in conversation remain unchanged
- Consider creating a new branch instead of deleting items

**Response:**
Returns the conversation object (not the deleted item)

parameters.description: Conversation ID (format: conv_xxxxx)
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description: Item ID to delete (format: msg_xxxxx)
parameters.name: item_id

400.description: Invalid conversation ID or item ID format

404.description: Conversation or item not found, or access denied

post.description:
Creates a chat completion with automatic referrer assignment. The referrer from the URL path will be automatically set in the conversation metadata.

**Referrer Assignment:**
- Referrer is extracted from URL path parameter
- Automatically creates or uses conversation with the specified referrer
- Same features as standard chat completions (streaming, tools, etc.)

**Storage Options:**
- `store=true`: Persist the latest input message and assistant response to the active conversation
- `store_reasoning=true`: Additionally persist reasoning content provided by the model
- When `store` is omitted or false, the conversation remains read-only

**URL Pattern:** `/v1/referrer/{referrer}/chat/completions`

**Example:** `/v1/referrer/customer-support/chat/completions`
post.summary: Create a chat completion with referrer context

parameters.description: Referrer name for conversation grouping
parameters.name: referrer

parameters.description: Chat completion request (referrer will be auto-set)
parameters.name: request

get.description:
Retrieves a list of available models within a referrer context. The referrer parameter is ignored and all available models are returned (same as /v1/models).

**URL Pattern:** `/v1/referrer/{referrer}/models`

**Example:** `/v1/referrer/customer-support/models`

parameters.description: Referrer name (ignored, provided for API consistency)
parameters.name: referrer

parameters.description: Set to true to include provider metadata
parameters.name: X-PROVIDER-DATA

200.description: List of models with provider metadata

get.description: Returns the current build version of the API server.

format.description: Audio format: mp3, wav, pcm16, etc.

call_id.description: ID of the function call this responds to

format.description: Audio format: mp3, wav, pcm16, etc.

x-enum-comments.ItemStatusIncomplete: Not started or partially complete (OpenAI uses this instead of "pending")

x-enum-descriptions: Not started or partially complete (OpenAI uses this instead of "pending")

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when screenshot was taken

text.description: Changed from "value" to match OpenAI spec

x-enum-comments.ModelCatalogStatusFilled: may update from Provider like OpenRouter
x-enum-comments.ModelCatalogStatusUpdated: manually updated by admin (cannot be auto-updated anymore

x-enum-descriptions: may update from Provider like OpenRouter
manually updated by admin (cannot be auto-updated anymore

currency.description: "USD" (fixed if you only bill in USD)

lines.description: flexible: add/remove units without schema churn

chat_template_kwargs.description:
ChatTemplateKwargs provides a way to add non-standard parameters to the request body.
Additional kwargs to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template.
Such as think mode for qwen3. "chat_template_kwargs": {"enable_thinking": false}
https://qwen.readthedocs.io/en/latest/deployment/vllm.html#thinking-non-thinking-modes

conversation.description:
Conversation can be either a string (conversation ID) or a conversation object
Items from this conversation are prepended to Messages for this response request.
Input items and output items from this response are automatically added to this conversation after completion.

guided_choice.description:
GuidedChoice is a vLLM-specific extension that restricts the model's output
to one of the predefined string choices provided in this field. This feature
is used to constrain the model's responses to a controlled set of options,
ensuring predictable and consistent outputs in scenarios where specific
choices are required.

logit_bias.description:
LogitBias is must be a token id string (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer), not a word string.
incorrect: `"logit_bias":{"You": 6}`, correct: `"logit_bias":{"1639": 6}`
refs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-logit_bias

logprobs.description:
LogProbs indicates whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not.
If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.
This option is currently not available on the gpt-4-vision-preview model.

max_completion_tokens.description:
MaxCompletionTokens An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion,
including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

max_tokens.description:
MaxTokens The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion.
This value can be used to control costs for text generated via API.
Deprecated: use MaxCompletionTokens. Not compatible with o1-series models.
refs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-max_tokens

metadata.description: Metadata to store with the completion.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Disable the default behavior of parallel tool calls by setting it: false.

reasoning_effort.description: Controls effort on reasoning for reasoning models. It can be set to "low", "medium", or "high".

safety_identifier.description:
A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating OpenAI's usage policies.
The IDs should be a string that uniquely identifies each user.
We recommend hashing their username or email address, in order to avoid sending us any identifying information.
https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat_create-safety_identifier

service_tier.description: Specifies the latency tier to use for processing the request.

store.description: Store controls whether the latest input and generated response should be persisted

store_reasoning.description: StoreReasoning controls whether reasoning content (if present) should also be persisted

stream_options.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set stream: true.

tool_choice.description: This can be either a string or an ToolChoice object.

top_logprobs.description:
TopLogProbs is an integer between 0 and 5 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each
token position, each with an associated log probability.
logprobs must be set to true if this parameter is used.

verbosity.description:
Verbosity determines how many output tokens are generated. Lowering the number of
tokens reduces overall latency. It can be set to "low", "medium", or "high".
Note: This field is only confirmed to work with gpt-5, gpt-5-mini and gpt-5-nano.
Also, it is not in the API reference of chat completion at the time of writing,
though it is supported by the API.

enable.description: Required: true to enable, false to disable

except_models.description: List of model keys to exclude

catalog_ids.description: Optional: specific catalog public IDs. If empty, applies to all catalogs

enable.description: Required: true to enable, false to disable

except_models.description: List of model keys to exclude from the operation

id.description: The unique ID of the conversation

finish_reason.description:
FinishReason
stop: API returned complete message,
or a message terminated by one of the stop sequences provided via the stop parameter
length: Incomplete model output due to max_tokens parameter or token limit
function_call: The model decided to call a function
content_filter: Omitted content due to a flag from our content filters
null: API response still in progress or incomplete

name.description:
This property isn't in the official documentation, but it's in
the documentation for the official library for python:
- https://github.com/openai/openai-python/blob/main/chatml.md
- https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken.ipynb

reasoning_content.description:
This property is used for the "reasoning" feature supported by deepseek-reasoner
which is not in the official documentation.
the doc from deepseek:
- https://api-docs.deepseek.com/api/create-chat-completion#responses

tool_call_id.description: For Role=tool prompts this should be set to the ID given in the assistant's prior request to call a tool.

tool_calls.description: For Role=assistant prompts this may be set to the tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

arguments.description: call function with arguments in JSON format

parameters.description:
Parameters is an object describing the function.
You can pass json.RawMessage to describe the schema,
or you can pass in a struct which serializes to the proper JSON schema.
The jsonschema package is provided for convenience, but you should
consider another specialized library if you require more complex schemas.

bytes.description: Omitting the field if it is null

top_logprobs.description:
TopLogProbs is a list of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position.
In rare cases, there may be fewer than the number of requested top_logprobs returned.

content.description: Content is a list of message content tokens with log probability information.

include_usage.description:
If set, an additional chunk will be streamed before the data: [DONE] message.
The usage field on this chunk shows the token usage statistics for the entire request,
and the choices field will always be an empty array.
All other chunks will also include a usage field, but with a null value.

index.description: Index is not nil only in chat completion chunk object

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: Chat completion endpoints for conversational AI

bearerAuth.description: Enter your Jan Server API key. Configure authentication in your server settings.
